availability.p: For internal use by the Faclair na Gàidhlig/DASG projects

summary.p: A single folio containing (the end of) a tract on prognosis, a personal note, and the pedigree of MacDougalls of Dunollie. Ronald Black has judged the MS to be in the hand of Eoghan Mac Pháill on the basis of its similarity to that in NLS Adv. 72.1.34.

msItem.title: Personal note
msItem.explicit: ...... uair ni roibh agum ach coinneal mailli deifir mhor.

titleStmt.title: Personal note by Eoghan mac Pháill

note.p: The scribe originally wrote a g and then changed the letter to a t.
Due to the fold it is difficult to ascertain whether or not there is another letter present between the first angular character, understood as a d in the present transcription, and the g.
The number 71 appears after this. The present editor postulates that this is a pagination mark.
